meanings.definition: To react excessively or too strongly to a stimulus.
meanings.sent1: She always overresponds to criticism, getting upset over small things.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overrespond to jokes, laughing loudly even at the simplest ones.
meanings.sent3: When the cat meowed, the dog overresponded by barking nonstop.
meanings.sent4: Her heart overresponded to the sad movie, making her cry uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock overresponded, blaring so loudly that it woke up the entire neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To reply or answer in an exaggerated or extreme manner.
meanings.sent1: The politician overresponded to the question, giving a long and detailed answer.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overrespond to text messages, sending paragraphs in response to simple questions.
meanings.sent3: When asked about his favorite food, he overresponded by listing every dish he had ever eaten.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overresponded when she received the surprise gift, jumping up and down with joy.
meanings.sent5: The comedian overresponded to the heckler, delivering a comeback that left the audience in stitches.
